activities.loc: Parties to appear remotely via Zoom (SC-2095)

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Roger F Rotter

defendant.name: Rotter, Roger F
defendant.address: 568 Lowestoft Ln, Elk Grove Village, IL 60007

records.addlTxt: 2nd competency examination, to be done by Dr. Kohlenberg and Dr. Piering (separately). Signed by Judge Carter on 11/01/2021.

10:31 AM Defendant Roger F Rotter appeared by video.  Attorney Daniel P. Murray in court for Roger F Rotter.  Prosecuting attorney Melissa J. Zilavy in court for the State of Wisconsin. All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing. Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 

Defense agrees that the Defendant in not competent, but does not agree with examiner that the Defendant would be restored to competency in 12 months. For reasons stated on the record, Defense is requesting to proceed under 971.14(5)(b). Defense would like to speak to charging DA on this case to hopefully come to an agreement. 

State requests a contested competency hearing. 

Defense asks for 1 day for contested competency hearing, and a hearing to be set before. 
 
Court sets contested competency hearing and a status hearing. 

Court will appoint doctors Dr. Peder Piering and Dr. Cary Kohlenberg to do competency examination as they have previously examined the Defendant on another matter.
Hearing scheduled for December 9, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Competency hearing scheduled for December 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Competency hearing on December 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Hearing on December 9, 2022 at 10:00 am.
filed by Dr Niess
Review hearing on October 10, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Letter from Bonnie Lane of Family Support Services, filed by atty. Murray.  CC Rieck orders the letter be restricted to confidential.
Signed by CC Rieck on 08/24/2022.

BOND MODIFIED ON 08/24/2022: If DNA sample has not been taken from the defendant, the Court orders sample to be taken;  and it may be expunged under 165.77(4) Wis. Statutes. 

PREVIOUS CONDITIONS:
Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle during the pendency of the case.   The Defendant is not to leave the continental united states.    Defendant to surrender their passport to the Waukesha Criminal Traffic Office (Room C226) within 48 hours of release from custody.  Defendant is not permitted to apply for the issuance,  duplicate nor renewal of a passport and/or passport card during the pendency of this action.

8:16 AM Defendant Roger F Rotter not in court.  Attorney Daniel P. Murray in court for Roger F Rotter.  Attorney Randy P. Sitzberger in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Attorney Murray presents statements as to the Defendant's non appearance at today's hearing, stating the Defendant is in treatment.
DEFENSE COUNSEL REQUESTS ORDER FOR COMPETENCY PURSUANT TO SEC.. 971.14(2).  Court grants request and orders the defendant be examined by the Wisconsin Forensic Unit.  To be done as an outpatient basis within 30 days. 
The State does not object.
The Court will adjourn the matter to the Trial Court.
Attorney Murray is to work with the Defendant to sign his amended cash bond.
Review hearing scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 4, the Honorable Lloyd V. Carter, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).
Preliminary hearing on August 24, 2022 at 08:15 am.

09:15 AM Defendant Roger F Rotter appeared Zoom with attorney Daniel P. Murray.  Randy Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.

Attorney Murray states he filed a letter requesting an adjournment as the Defendant is in treatment.
The State does not object.
The Court will adjourn.
Preliminary time limits previously waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 24, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Request to adjourn Preliminary Hearing
  **Reviewed by Commissioner Kevin Costello on 06-27-2022. "Switch matter to that of Status on Prelim. Defense Counsel and defendant may appear by Zoom or in person."
Receipt of Passport surrendered to the Court. 05-31-2022 Defendant in Custody

01:12 PM Defendant Roger F Rotter in court with attorney Daniel P. Murray.   Alyssa Jay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.
